dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Kazakh Embassy in Washington is urging its citizens under U.S. deportation orders to voluntarily return home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Kazakh Embassy in Washington is urging its citizens under U.S. deportation orders to voluntarily return home.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Embassy of Kazakhstan in Washington has urged citizens who are in the U.S. under a deportation order to take advantage of the opportunity to voluntarily return to their homeland in order to avoid fines and other sanctions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, yeah, I saw that. They're really pushing for people to use that CBP Home app to arrange their own departure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, yeah, I saw that. They're really pushing for people to use that C B P Home app to arrange their own departure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We draw your attention to the fact that U.S. authorities are urging foreign nationals who have a court-issued deportation order but remain in the country to voluntarily return home as soon as possible using the CBP Home mobile application," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're even offering financial assistance for plane tickets if needed, which is, uh, a pretty significant incentive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're even offering financial assistance for plane tickets if needed, which is, uh, a pretty significant incentive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are also eligible for financial assistance if they cannot afford a plane ticket and may retain the right to legally return to the U.S. in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the alternative is just brutal—like, up to $998 per day in fines if you stay past the order.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the alternative is just brutal-like, up to nine hundred ninety eight dollars per day in fines if you stay past the order.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If a person remains in the U.S. despite a deportation order, a fine of $998 per day will be levied retroactively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Per day? That's insane. And it's retroactive too, so it could add up to a million dollars for some people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Per day? That's insane. And it's retroactive too, so it could add up to a million dollars for some people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This applies to individuals with deportation rulings issued within the past five years. The fine may reach up to $1 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and if they can't pay, the U.S. might actually seize their property. That's… intense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and if they can't pay, the U.S. might actually seize their property. That's... intense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the fine cannot be paid, the U.S. government may consider seizing property owned by foreign nationals unlawfully residing in the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, if they don't report through the app, there's an additional fine—anywhere from one to five thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, if they don't report through the app, there's an additional fine-anywhere from one to five thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If a citizen fails to return home and does not report via CBP Home, an additional fine ranging from $1,000 to $5,000 will be imposed," the message states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's the re-entry ban, which basically shuts down any future legal immigration options.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's the re-entry ban, which basically shuts down any future legal immigration options.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other measures include a ban on re-entry into the U.S., which effectively revokes the person's right to legally enter the country through immigration channels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like they're really trying to avoid enforcement measures, like immediate detention or deportation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like they're really trying to avoid enforcement measures, like immediate detention or deportation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those who refuse voluntary return will face specific enforcement measures. The migrant may be subject to immediate deportation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, especially with all the talk about potential mass deportations if Trump gets reelected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, especially with all the talk about potential mass deportations if Trump gets reelected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that media outlets have reported that Donald Trump's administration plans to deport one million undocumented migrants during the first year of his potential new term as president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—the embassy mentioned that context too. They're basically saying, "Look, take this chance now before things get even tougher."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-the embassy mentioned that context too. They're basically saying, Look, take this chance now before things get even tougher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that media outlets have reported that Donald Trump's administration plans to deport one million undocumented migrants during the first year of his potential new term as president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a stark warning, but also kind of a lifeline for those who might not have other options.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a stark warning, but also kind of a lifeline for those who might not have other options.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Voluntary return lets them leave on their own terms and maybe even keep the door open to come back someday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Voluntary return lets them leave on their own terms and maybe even keep the door open to come back someday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are also eligible for financial assistance if they cannot afford a plane ticket and may retain the right to legally return to the U.S. in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a tough situation, but at least there's a path that doesn't involve getting hit with massive fines or losing everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a tough situation, but at least there's a path that doesn't involve getting hit with massive fines or losing everything.
